alert.note: Alert for Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 15 at 12:38PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH FOR AN ICE JAM REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam continues to be possible. * WHERE...The Yukon River at the Dalton Highway Bridge, Stevens Village, and Beaver * WHEN...Through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Ice jam flooding is possible at Beaver today and Stevens Village and the Yukon River Bridge tonight or Tuesday. If an ice jam forms, water will rise very rapidly and people may need to evacuate to higher ground at a moments notice. Large ice chunks could also push overbank and into communities. Prepare your community now for flooding, and where possible, move items to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Significant ice jam flooding occurred at Fort Yukon and Circle over the weekend. This surge of ice and water is moving downriver and expected to reach Beaver today and Stevens Village tonight or Tuesday morning. It is possible this surge of ice and water may get stopped and jam when it meets intact ice downriver. As of Noon Monday, the River Watch team reported ice has locally shifted at Stevens Village. Strong ice remains in place downstream of Stevens Village at the start of the Rampart Canyon and there is a high probability ice could jam in this location and cause flooding at Stevens Village. - Http://weather.gov/aprfc - If you live near or along the Yukon River from the Yukon River Bridge upstream to Beaver, stay alert and be prepared to take action.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
